findings.title: No Balance Modifier function found
findings.description: If there is a function for this, the contract owner can have the authority to modify the balance of tokens at other addresses.

findings.title: No Blacklist Setting function found
findings.description: If there is a blacklist, some addresses may not be able to trade normally. Example: you buy the token and right after your Wallet getting blacklisted. Like so you will be unable to sell. Honeypot Risk.

findings.title: Whitelist Setting function found
findings.description: If there is a function for this, Developer can set zero fee or no max wallet size for addresses (for example team wallets can trade without fee. Can cause farming)

findings.title: No Hidden or multi owner with authorisation
findings.description: For contract with a hidden owner, developer can still manipulate the contract even if the ownership has been abandoned.

findings.title: No Functions found which can retrieve ownership of the contract
findings.description: If this function exists, it is possible for the project owner to regain ownership even after relinquishing it. Also known as fake renounce.

findings.title: No Self Destruct function found
findings.description: If this function exists and is triggered, the contract will be destroyed, all functions will be unavailable, and all related assets will be erased.
